document_data.caption: An avatar of Sekolah, the Shark-Father, surrounded by [[sahuagin]] worshipers.
document_data.name: Sekolah
document_data.title:
The Great Shark{{cite book/Defenders of the Faith|95}}
The Shark-Father
The Joyful Hunter
The Caller from the Depths
document_data.domains3e: [[Evil domain|Evil]], [[Law domain|Law]], [[Ocean domain|Ocean]], [[Strength domain|Strength]], [[Tyranny domain|Tyranny]], [[War domain|War]]
document_data.favored weapon3e: [[Trident]]<ref group="note" name="note1">[[Faiths and Pantheons]]' page 221 gives the greataxe as Sekolah's favored weapon. This is a mistake made by Sean K. Reynolds as he explains and corrects [https://web.archive.org/web/20200123215151/www.seankreynolds.com/rpgfiles/we/ZZZcorrectedmonsterdeitytable.html here].
document_data.mainbody: kolah's [[avatar]] was a huge great white shark.
document_data.Personality: Sekolah cared little for his followers, instead encouraging them to be self-sufficient.
document_data.Powers: Sekolah's avatar emitted an aura of fear and was able to swallow a man whole. It was immune to fear and other forms of pacification of itself.
document_data.Divine Realm: Sekolah resided in [[Stygia]] in the realm of [[Sheyruushk]] in [[Baator]].
document_data.Activities: Sekolah rarely sent his avatar forth to assist his followers unless victory over their enemies seemed inevitable. He would do so to sate his own bloodlust on gargantuan creatures of the sea however.{{Cite dungeon/193/Tavern Profile:The Beached Leviathan|33}}
document_data.Relationships: Sekolah had an ongoing rivalry with [[Demogorgon]], which carried over to his followers' rivalry with the ray-like race of [[ixitxachitl]].
document_data.Worshipers:
[[File:Sahuaginpriestess.jpg|thumb|220x220px|''A priestess of Sekolah.'']]
Sekolah's relation to his priests, like all sahuagin, was uncaring and standoffish. Although he did grant them [[spell]]s, he was not opposed to his priests having temporary pacts with other evil deities.
document_data.History: One of Sekolah's most influential followers was [[Iakhovas]], also known as "He Who Swims With Sekolah".
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Legend had it that Sekolah discovered the sahuagin race after he had defeated a great enemy in the sea. Sekolah was singing a victory song that echoed off a great rift in the sea floor. A seashell arose from the rift and Sekolah found it full of sahuagin. In his joy, he adopted the race as his own and scattered them throughout the seas to multiply on their own.
